Title: Navy deactivates illegal refining sites, confiscates stolen crude oil in Rivers
Summary: The Nigerian Navy has scored a major victory in its fight against crude oil theft . The Navy deactivates illegal refining sites, confiscates stolen crude oil in Rivers . 124,000 litres of stolen oil were seized in the Awokiri area of Bonny Local Government .

Title: Pharmacists slam NMA over resistance to consultant cadre
Summary: Pharmacists slam NMA over resistance to consultant cadre . Pharmacists under the aegis of the West Africa Postgraduate College of Pharmacists (WAPCP) strongly criticised the Nigerian Medical Association .

Title: Aiyedatiwa unveils climate change, circular economy plan for Ondo
Summary: Governor of Ondo State, Lucky Aiyedatiwa, has approved the establishment of a committee to develop a circular economy, climate change policy, and roadmap . The committee aims to advance environmental sustainability and climate resilience .

Summary: Federal Government committed to clearing remaining three months' arrears of N35,000 to civil servants without further delay . The Federal Government says it is committed to paying the remaining three month's arrear . The government says it will clear the remaining N35k wage award .

Title: CREDICORP, NYSC launch ₦200,000 loan scheme for corps members
Summary: The Nigerian Consumer Credit Corporation (CREDICORP) has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the National Youth Service Corps (NYSC) to provide Corps Members with access to credit facilities of up to ₦200,000 each . The initiative is under a new initiative tagged YouthCred.

Title: Bakassi Ceding: Cross River deserves justice — Rep. Akpanke
Summary: Rep. Peter Akpanke has called for a revisit of the decisions surrounding the ceding of the Bakassi Peninsula to Cameroon by the International Court of Justice (ICJ), and the transfer of 76 oil wells from Cross River State . He said these events have had long-lasting impacts on the state’s development .
